slides.title: Understanding Atomic Structure
slides.content:
UNDERSTANDING ATOMIC STRUCTURE

- Atoms are tiny building blocks that make up everything around us.
- Atoms have even smaller parts called protons, neutrons, and electrons.
- Protons have a positive charge, electrons have a negative charge, and neutrons have no charge.
slides.objective: Define Atomic Structure and recall the basic components
slides.speakerNotes: SUPPORT Level: Simplified vocabulary and concepts for struggling learners. Focus on foundational understanding.

slides.title: Parts of an Atom
slides.content:
Title: Parts of an Atom

Content:
1. Atoms are tiny building blocks of everything.
2. Atoms have three parts: protons, neutrons, and electrons.
3. Protons have a positive charge, electrons have a negative charge, and neutrons have no charge.
slides.objective: Explain the structure of an atom and the roles of protons, neutrons, and electrons
slides.speakerNotes: SUPPORT Level: Simplified vocabulary and concepts for struggling learners. Focus on foundational understanding.

slides.title: Electron Configuration
slides.content:
TITLE: How Electrons are Arranged

- Electrons are tiny particles that move around the center of an atom (like planets orbiting the sun).
- Each atom has a specific way its electrons are organized, called electron configuration (how electrons are arranged in an atom).
- Understanding electron configuration helps us know how atoms interact with each other (how atoms connect with one another).
slides.objective: Describe how electrons are arranged in energy levels around the nucleus
